question: Pillars
description: Which of the following pillars is the best fit for your workshop?
choices: Healing: to mend one’s mind and spirit from the damage accumulated during the battle for justice.
Advocacy: to persistently challenge the norms of society; to be part of making the world a safe place for all.
Re-Centering: to center the voices of the most marginalized among us.
Collaboration: to work jointly with others. We must learn to effectively collaborate to achieve liberation because all oppressions are connected.

question: Are there any content warnings for this workshop?
choices: Ableism: Actions, attitudes, or systems with discriminatory impact based on actual or perceived difference of ability or disability.
Biphobia or Homophobia: Actions, attitudes, or systems with discriminatory impact based on actual or perceived sexual orientation.
Bullying or Violence: The use of force, threat, or coercion to abuse, intimidate or aggressively dominate others. This can be done through physical, verbal, emotional, digital, or any other method.
Classism: Actions, attitudes, or systems with discriminatory impact based on actual or perceived wealth or socioeconomic status.
Eating Disorders: Behavioral disorder defined by eating habits that negatively affect a person’s physical, mental, and/or emotional health.
Fatphobia: Actions, attitudes, or systems with discriminatory impact based on actual or perceived obesity or status as overweight.
Racism: Actions, attitudes, or systems with discriminatory impact based on actual or perceived race and/or ethnicity.

Relationship Violence: Relationships where one person maintains power and control over another. Can include physical abuse, emotional abuse, sexual abuse and coercion, reproductive coercion, financial abuse, or digital abuse.
Sexism: Actions, attitudes, or systems with discriminatory impact based on actual or perceived sex or gender identity.
Sexual Violence: An act in which a person sexually touches another person without that person’s consent or coerces or physically forces a person to engage in a sexual act against their will.
Substance Abuse: Patterned use of a drug in which the user consumes the substance in amounts or with methods which are harmful to themselves or others.
Transphobia: Actions, attitudes, or systems with discriminatory impact based on actual or perceived status as transgender.
Xenophobia: Actions, attitudes, or systems with discriminatory impact based on actual or perceived nationality.
